items.title: VA Lighthouse API Portal — Current API Catalog
items.key_takeaway: VA Lighthouse provides a set of HIPAA‑subject APIs (FHIR R4, benefits, facilities, etc.) requiring OAuth 2.0 with PKCE; essential for building VA health and benefits applications.

items.title: CMS Interoperability and Patient Access Final Rule (CMS-9115-F)
items.key_takeaway: CMS final rule mandates that CMS‑regulated payers expose patient data via FHIR R4 APIs (Patient Access, Provider Directory, payer‑to‑payer exchange), impacting any app handling Medicare/Medicaid claims or clinical data.

items.title: TEFCA (Trusted Exchange Framework and Common Agreement)
items.key_takeaway: TEFCA establishes a national framework for health information exchange, requiring any app that connects to the U.S. health data network to meet QHIN requirements, identity proofing, consent management, and data use agreements.

items.title: HIPAA Security Rule — Technical Safeguards
items.key_takeaway: HIPAA Security Rule technical safeguards mandate access controls, audit logs, integrity/authentication measures, and encryption for any mobile or web app handling ePHI, requiring strict implementation to stay compliant.
